main event: On July 23, 1957, a circular, shiny white object, described to be the size of a basketball, was observed hovering in New York City, NY, at 3:21 A.M.
interesting points: The object was observed at a 45-degree angle with unknown azimuth and eventually moved in a straight line from east to west
Weather conditions at the time included light winds at 6000 ft from the southeast and a cloudy sky
No photographs were taken of the object, and the observation lasted for approximately 10 seconds
The report includes details from a U.S. weather bureau stating basic meteorological conditions in New York City on the date of the sighting
The observation was classified as a Ground-Radar type with no photographs available
